meanings.definition: A person who steals goods or valuables by force.
meanings.sent1: The plunderer sneaked into the house and took the shiny jewels.
meanings.sent2: The villagers were terrified of the plunderer who raided their homes.
meanings.sent3: The cunning plunderer tried to steal a pie from the windowsill but got caught.
meanings.sent4: The pirate captain was known as the plunderer of the high seas.
meanings.sent5: The notorious plunderer left a trail of stolen treasures behind him.

meanings.definition: To rob or steal goods or valuables by force.
meanings.sent1: The bandits planned to plunder the caravan traveling through the desert.
meanings.sent2: The invaders would plunder the village, taking everything of value.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon managed to plunder the picnic basket when nobody was looking.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to plunder the land of its greenery, leaving a barren landscape.
meanings.sent5: The treasure hunters hoped to plunder the ancient tomb for hidden riches.
